page.title: 11HOLKAM HALL WILD ANIMALS
page.content: There are a variety of wild animals at Holkham Hall. There are deer that are very popular with the tourists. There are about 550 does and 250 bucks. There are 700 deer permanently on the park. In October, November and December 200 deer are killed and sent to the local butcher. The does mate in late Autumn though at this time many of the young bucks are wounded by older and stronger bucks in fights over the does. It is very likely that an old buck may be defeated by a young buck. After the mating season the doe will look for a suitable tree where there are a lot of nettles where she can give birth. A doe can give birth as early as January though March or April is more usual. During that time all the nettles around the trees are left alone by the farmers so that the doe is not disturbed.
